DOC.detailed_description: MS affect least 400,000 people US alone , incidence increase past 50 year , likely due change environmental risk factor . Recent research suggest diet may critical factor development MS . The `` Western diet '' , high sugar , fat , salt , may influence MS risk progression directly affect immune system , alter gut bacteria , change metabolism . Studying patient MS overweight obese may relevant obesity cause chronic low-grade inflammation , potentially worsen MS symptom . Diet modification represent interesting potential therapy MS , particularly calorie restriction fasting , associate reduce marker inflammation . In addition direct effect , weight optimization may lead improvement MS-related symptom , like fatigue , overall quality life . This single-blinded randomized trial adherence dietary intervention patient MS receive monthly natalizumab infusion . The study evaluate use technology may help patient MS adhere calorie restrict diet . It also evaluate effect weight loss fatigue quality life patient MS. A second part study evaluate shortening period day people consume typical food amount lead improvement patient-reported outcome .
